<td width="62%" align="center" valign="top"> <table width="98%" height="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" summary="layout table">

Leeds Trinity’s mission, values and tradition commits it to embracing social responsibility and reaching out to the less advantaged.  It recognises that one of the main barriers to human improvement and participation in education is poverty.
As a commitment to empowering some of those less fortunate, Leeds Trinity has been supporting the Fair Trade campaign through its procurement of Fair Trade products.
Leeds Trinity has been successful in attaining Fair-Trade accreditation.

A steering group comprising of: Student Union President, Catering Manager & Hospitality Services Director (chair) has been set up to discuss, plan and promote Fair-Trade initiatives and activities.  It has established an annual calendar of events, advertising campaigns through the Student Union and the Catering department.  The steering group is currently involved in planning events for Fair-Trade fortnight between 26 February and 11 March 2007.
Leeds Trinity has considerably widened its range and variety of Fair-Trade products for sale throughout the college and provides Fair-Trade tea and coffee for all meeting and functions.
Leeds Trinity Fairtrade Policy Statement
British Association for Fair Trade Shops
Arranged and co-ordinated by: Fair–Trade Steering Group (Chair – Dominique Owen) d.owen@leedstrinty.ac.uk
All Saints, Brownberrie Lane, Horsforth, Leeds, LS18 5HD
